page.title: 17St Annes - Employment Survey
page.content: A selection of local people were interviewed in order to assess the employment advantages of a local commercial area.Many of the people were self_employed or worked in fairly small business concerns.All were over 21.Because of the local nature of the survey area,some travelled to work on foot or cycle,although many still by car.Normal commercial hours were main_ tained,9 AM to 5.30 PM,although some to 7 PM.Others worked part_time.Many considered the level of pay to be the major disadvantage of their chosen occupation.General comments were very favourable,with many citing the pleasant local area and high standard of the immediate working conditions as substantial advantages.The suburban nature of the shopping area clearly meant that people felt themselves to be an important part of the community.
